channel.title: W3C Tracking Protection Working Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Tracking Protection Working Group

item.title: [tracking-dnt] Don't recommend navigator.doNotTrack (which is also deprecated)?
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/DNT

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/DNT#reading_do_not_track_status_from_javascript

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The example says:

Reading Do Not Track status from JavaScript

The user's DNT preference can also be read from JavaScript using the Navigator.doNotTrack property:

navigator.doNotTrack; // "0", "1" or null

But if I click through to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/doNotTrack, it also says:

Deprecated: This feature is no longer recommended. Though some browsers might still support it, it may have already been removed from the relevant web standards, may be in the process of being dropped, or may only be kept for compatibility purposes. Avoid using it, and update existing code if possible; see the compatibility table at the bottom of this page to guide your decision. Be aware that this feature may cease to work at any time.

What did you expect to see?

Maybe delete the mention of doNotTrack if it isn't a valid alternative.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

MDN metadata

Page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/http/headers/dnt
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/DNT
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/http/headers/dnt/index.md
  • Last commit: 83d678b
  • Document last modified: 2023-03-20T21:38:08.000Z

item.title: [tracking-dnt] Web/HTTP/Headers/DNT: has ambigious deprecation notice
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/DNT

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

The deprecation notice and metadata tags

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The browser compatibility section lists only Safari as unsupported, and this press makes it seem like a marketing decision to me, and the W3C spec also looks healthy? I don't understand how GPC is replacing DNT when it's still a proposal.

MDN metadata

Page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/http/headers/dnt
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/DNT
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/http/headers/dnt/index.md
  • Last commit: 36001a2
  • Document last modified: 2022-09-09T05:53:39.000Z

item.title: [tracking-dnt] Issue with "Navigator.doNotTrack": What was this deprecated tech replaced with?
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/doNotTrack

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The deprecation-note is quite unhelpful, since it does not state what it was replaced with.

Specific section or headline?

The deprecation note.

What did you expect to see?

Some explanation of what the DnT setting was replaced with.

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/navigator/donottrack
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/doNotTrack
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/navigator/donottrack/index.md
  • Last commit: 2279e5a
  • Document last modified: 2021-09-14T18:08:09.000Z
